Articles.Content:
Kerbal Space Program - The eagle has sort of landed

Yet another normal day at the KSC

Actually, this thing didn\'t just tip over, it fell from 5km after a failed booster launch almost ended the mission, i decided to ditch all stages but the lander stage and try to land on the surface, either by miracle or accident, i hit the edge of the ramp leading to the launch pad, flipping over, and didn\'t explode.

I think i\'ll try aiming closer to the mun next time.
You know what they say.. any landing you can walk away from is a good one..
This has been a successful test of the booster failure flight abort pad impact inverted ground contact contingency system. Have a nice day.

This has been a successful test of the booster failure flight abort pad impact inverted ground contact contingency system. Had this been a real failure, more hilarity would of ensured and more new sets of pants would of been needed. Have a nice day.

TFTFY

Pretty much my daily routine. Build rocket, it crashes on start.

Nahh, it was supposed to be a hovercraft anyway.

I\'ve always gone by the assumption that if the crew manages to land back on Kerbin without dying, it\'s a success. I just call it a test of whatever stages it safely gets through and the landing stage.
If rockets are to hard for you, just place some RCS tanks and a lot of Down Under thrusters on them. Safe for children ;P (warranty void if used without parachute)
